Review: Recommend more choices of food.

Room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. Bathroom was clean as well. Breakfast spread was filling and delicious. Service was overall okay. Only mishap we had was that the people who came in after us were given a table in the main area while we were directed towards the “extension” which was just a function hall. I felt profiling and discrimination because both parties were made-up of 3 people in a group. So I don’t see why we were not offered to be seated at the main area when we arrived way before the other group. The other group was seated at the main area before we were asked if we were okay with being seated at the extension.
The Buffet breakfast was excellent! Staff were very friendly and helpful!
The standard is being maintained.
The hotel is conveniently located beside Abreeza Mall. Front desk staff was really helpful. The rooms were spacious but needs a little bit of 'detailing'. Some paint has bubbled and is about to peel.

This was my second stay in SEDA Davao. The first one two years was good because I was alone. But the second stay wasn't that really pleasant. I booked 2 rooms on 6-7 May 2018 for 6 people for a night stay. I was of course expecting that they will provide us beds good for 3 persons each room. But unfortunately when we arrived there and checked in. There were only 2 single beds inside the rooms. I felt I was short changed of the money I payed for 6 people. About the facilities, inside the room there were white paint marks on the floor in our room. The swimming pool is smaller than I thought. The food was ok but I think expensive. Location wise, it's great place to stay because just only a few steps to Abreeza Mall. I dunno if I still have to book this hotel on my next travel.

This is my 2nd Seda hotel stay, the first being in Iloilo, and I’ve been hooked ever since! I love the huge bed and spacious room, and how comfortable the bed and pillows were. The breakfast was buffet was a treat! Various Filipino dishes were in the buffet spread, liked the tocino and danggit most especially. Dessert was also yummy! Ube and mocha cake, puto and palitaw. All in all it was a perfect stay, since the hotel had it’s own private path going to the mall.

We stayed in all the major hotels in Davao on this trip and Seda Abreeza was head and shoulders above the rest. It felt like home in Davao and I have no complaints, which is rare. This is simply a great hotel run by exceptional staff for what must be a company of excellence that manages the hotel. The breakfast buffet was always top notch, with friendly servers and great food. The doormen went out of their way to provide the best service. The pool and recreation areas were clean and pleasant places to relax with the family. All the shopping, food and entertainment one could want at the Abeeza mall across the street. Its the best, safest, cleanest hotel in Davao by a far.
-Room is nice and clean -Staffs are friendly and helpful -Great location and easy access to mall and church -lovely buffet breakfast -downside is the wifi its just slow -great money value
everything is awesome except for wifi connection
Clean and hotel still feels new. Good location.
The best place to stay while you are in Davao.
nice location and value for money
Nice location. Clean room. Breakfast is good. Karl, Singapore

Seda is aware that it has many guests last 17-20 may 2018. It is disappointing that the restaurant staff did not anticipate this thus making many guests wait for almost an hour before they can take their breakfast. Knowing the limited space of the dining hall and the 11th floor lounge, contingency plans should had been undertaken to ensure that all the guests were accommodated. Other than this, seda met our expectations.
Very near Abreeza Mall, very nice hotel with very friendly staffs and efficient reception staffs or frontliner. Breakfast is good
Good value for money and good location but the view from our room are the dilapidated houses.
Staff are so good and the hotel is great Resturant is small and need to be bigger as lots of gust need to wait long time to be seated .
The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is superb. Had a wonderful stay.
Had breakfast at the restaurant but got there trays was empty so sad for a buffet. So much workers doing nothing. Staff so slow.
Bed linen wasn’t change had long hair on top the bed when I open. Shower area had mold between tiles. Trash can was so dirty. I was once a housekeeper for 10 years and didn’t see like it before.

The whole stay was great. My family didn't want to leave. Very friendly staff. The pool and hotel room were very clean. The breakfast buffet was amazing, best I ever had at a hotel (premier room executive suite). The location was great for shopping as its nearly connected to the Abeeza Alya Mall that has everything including great choices for food and entertainment. If you want a good clean safe hotel in Davao then this is for sure a top pick.

The location was fine and accessible. The staff/s ate friendly and accommodating.. It was only the cleanliness i am very particular with. The breakfast meals has so little for selection. The staff was not able to provide cutleries and set our table before giving it to us. We have to chase for them for utensils. Some guest no longer have breakfast optipns and no top up were made..
Very nice hotel to stay in Davao with family. Looking forward to stay again during next visit to this city.

Hotel is just across abreeza making all things very accessible. stayed on the 7th floor. rooms feel a bit old and the carpet on the hallways smells like smoke. I hope they do something to save the hotel considering that its relatively new.

Centrally located beside Abreeza Mall. Room is very clean and smells good. Staff are polite and customer oriented. Lobby and breakfast area needs improvement. You have to wait longer to be accomodated.

Hassle free check in and check out...well maintained rooms, clean barhroom, sheets and towels...staff were all courteous and professional. Near abreeza mall and other malls in davao...parking and transportation readily available...buffet breakfast is ok...
for me i love everything about this hotel

The hotel is just right beside Ayala Abreeza Mall, very convenient when it comes to restaurant, banks, and shopping. Quite close to the airport as well. The hotel is just okay. The breakfast? Ahm its cold! Try turning on the food heaters! I ate the same food in my 3 nights stay.
The carpet in the room is very dirty and dusty. It should be cleaned.
Excellent hotel, very good location, efficient, courteous & very friendly staff. Had a great stay for 3 days with my family.

The staff of the hotel. From the front desk to the food outlet at the lobby were very friendly. Going out of their way to talk to the guests. But, terrible entertainment during dinner. It would be nice to have more than just one food outlet.
Rooms are not sound proof. You can hear the sounds and noise from the party hall.

Price was ok and location. Its across abreeza mall. But the hall way was so dirty and how they painted the wall was really shocking for me. I thought its a nice hotel. But it was like those inn not hotel. Specially toilet walls and shower area was really bad. But good thing bed was clean. If i go back to Davao i try to stay in other hotels but m not sure there are better ones available already. their food was good at the lobby area but price is little high.
nice location clean but pricey
clean ,nice location but pricey
our stay was good ,but only thing i would suggest if they can put bidet in their comfort rooms..
Will definitely come back
A local home grown brand that provides world class service and convenience across the Philippines. Seda is now a default hotel of choice across the country for any company trips
Excellent from security, assistance, maintenance to restaurant staff. They work extra mile to make your stay comfortable.
Breakfast is excellent it has variety of food to choose from. My kids loves the pool and most of all the location is perfect
Everything was perfect. very nice hotel. I would like to go back again.
staff and place was clean and close to abreeza mall

Positive - pool - Ayala Center is a stone throw away - you can buy or eat whatever you want - the president sneaks in to have coffee in the night - breakfast is strong Negative - I can’t think of any - this is a good place to stay in.

We would appreciate if staff will have the initiative to ask their guest upon check in re Ayala Rewards Circle membership card, so it would be automatic everytime we dine in we get the discounts on food. 😊 Thank you!

Place is good untill we left our phone on charge and not off and they didnt bother to call us right away!!! And why th hell our phone is off? If u say its off cauae u submitted it to the stuff thats fine but then When we called the front desk, they said they have to call us back cause they have to call the house keeping its been 12 hours since w check out. The place is good but neve left you belongings
Hotel and rooms are really nice, although it is quite secluded. There is a pool and there is a strip mall that has a few restaurants nearby. Good place to spend a few nights in.

The place is just across the mall where you can find restaurants. The hotel is not a 5 star, but its clean and accesible to transportation. Although Davao is a very traffic place to visit. Breakfast is good, and that one thing i love. Will come back again when i visit the traffic place of davao.

my phone was left at too 409 and they did not even bothered to call me to inform that my phone was there. I know i did not used that phone and was charging the whole day and using my other phone. Realized that i haven't got my other phone that i been charging on the room. How come your housekeeping didn't report right away that the phone was left. And when i call the phone it was off!! the fact that it was on when i left it there. The place is excellent location, food is good, but housekeeping is horrible. why?
Please improve the selections of the breakfast buffet especially the dessert section. Overall it was a nice stay. Will definitely choose this hotel again when we return!

Getting a Club floor rooms provide me the use of the Club business lounge at the 11th flr with free afternoon snack and early evening pica pica while I’m doing my emails. Also you can do meetings. Free breakfast have pleanty of choices Staff are all smile and accommodating. Hotel is 2 minutes walk to Ayala Abreeza mall. I will go back to this hotel again.
A little too busy these days, but still one of two best hotels to stay at when in Davao

Grat location, only 1 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The swimming pool is small but cozy. Breakfast, I would say is about average. All in all I would definitely stay there again.
Easy access to an upscale mall (food, shopping, entertainment). Staffed by friendly professionals. Rooms and facilities are well maintained and clean.
Cleanliness and attentive staff
Great facilities, wonderful staff, excellent breakfast, etc.

Nice choice enjoy with shopping just beside the hotel. H&m markspancer levis Robinson shopping and many more nice Korean food that I have tried Staff of the hotel is warm and polite... Medicine have to keep some due to I get cold but could not get medicine they don't sell any panadol there... Overall consider got choice They dont have hair dryer in the room You won't regret to stay here
Good location close to mall (just across the street) , new hotel with nice, clean rooms. Comfortable beds, and most importantly very nice staff.

I love this hotel! My husband and i stay here every year when we're in the city. The staff are overall amazing, clean hotel, good food and drinks. I highly recommend this hotel! We will back this april.

I stayed overnight on my birthday last 14 Feb. together with my parents. The check in and check out process was smooth. I was satisfied with the service they had provided as well as the room amenities. Will come back for sure! Thank you Seda Hotel Davao as well as the birthday cake you had given me.
the menus .. other than that its a perfect hotel to stay!!

Definitely would come back as always!. Very near Abreeza Mall. Stall are all very accommodating. Special mention to the good looking and very cordial Banquet Manager/ Assistant who extended a Valentine date table as we didn't have previous reservation. All in all it was a wonderful stay at SEDA Hotel

Great location, nice rooms but a bit expensive. Rooms not ready yet even if we booked online days earlier so we have to wait for 15 minutes for it to be ready for checking in. Front desk staff was however pleasant as he apologized and let us wait in the lounge. Overall it was a peasant stay for us.

The staff were helpful and polite especially Jules, Kristine, Karl, Mergent and Ornan. These staff members always welcome us with great smiles and provided us with great service. Our only constructive feedback is to improve the breakfast menu (too repeatetive) same every morning. Also the Misto restaurant is too small can’t cater for a large booking.
Had an amazing stay! Good hotel, nice and spacious rooms. Hotel staff very helpful! Breakfast buffet is really good! Will stay again when returning to Davao

The seda hotel in Davao city is very good, it is just a hop to abreeza mall and at the Center of the city. I stayed at seda with my husband and son but while in the hotel, my husband did his yoga session on the carpet. Surprisingly, he got redness on his skin and felt itchiness.
Friendly and helpful staff but the experience as a whole is let down by the state the hotel is in. No serious issues a quick renovation can’t fix.

This is the third time we have used this hotel. It is in a good location, very safe area, the mall is across the street, it is a nice mall with plenty of shopping and food available. The mall also has a movie theater so if your in the mood for a movie. I plan on going to Seda Abreeza every time I visit Davao
Very nice modern hotel. Fantastic buffet breakfeast alot of food to choose from. Good location next door to Abreeza Mall.

I had a week-long business in Davao and my stay at Seda made it pleasant and manageable. The staff were friendly, attentive and courteous. The lobby gets crowded in the morning but I liked coming in from my business meetings after dinner when it was quiet. The hotel was right across a small mall for emergency personal items.
Seda Hotel is my favorite hotel.I can walk to the ayala mall anytime and the staff of this hotel are friendly and helpful to the guest.

Weve been here a couple of times we kept on coming back because of the good location and good food. But our last stay was so disappointing we left our external drive in the television and they didnt return it to us :( all our files gone! Dishonest staffs!
The value for money doesn’t matched the expected facilities and location

Good place for city view with connection mall nearby within walking distance...but as a muslims i require a kiblat direction point signage on the room ceiling...please put it...as easy for others muslims to find kiblat direction for solah praying purposes... Overall...all of the staff a nice...especially the housekeeping guys...they are heroes!!! Good job guys...keep on the good work...very very friendly...

For the most part the staff are excellent, however the staff in the Executive lounge don’t smile and are not the friendliest which was surprising and. not welcoming nor any smiles or warmth., that was disappointing .
Comfortable Clean and convenient
I was expecting a room that can be compared to the same price and hotel rating in Manila. Unfortunately, it was below than I've expected.

Lovely staff. Room is spacious and clean but many issues. Shower head wasn’t working and so were some power points. Bloomberg channel on tv also had some problems and when the technician came he couldn’t solve the issue and suggested I watch BBC instead. Breakfast option was quite limited. I paid a lot more to upgrade to the club room but I didn’t feel the premium is worth . The room is exactly the same and only diff is the executive lounge which wasn’t much to shout about.

Stay was ok. Staff unreliable and slow-moving to our requests. Also before booking, we called and ask the reception desk if they have bed railings for I’m bring 2 children both below 5 years old with me. They assured me that they have it. But upon checking in, they told us that they don’t have any bed railings.
Most often we will get this hotel for holidays but we noticed it’s getting even more expensive .
It’s very new and near to the departmental store and walking distance to purchase your drinks and water. Traffic is good and not congested
Great and wonderful place with fantastic employee

The hotel is modern, and has a nice atmosphere. The only real problem with this hotel the matenance and care for the pool area . The music I had to request to be put on, also had to ask for cushions, had to go inside to the bar to get drinks and was not properly attended to, the hotel need to spiffy up the pool area
The title says it all

This hotel is on the same property as Abreeza Mall which makes it very convenient. The club lounge is nice for free snacks and drinks. The pool is adequate. The fixtures are a little dusty and tired for a hotel in this price range. The front desk staff are helpful, but the other staff not so much. Breakfast is somewhat underwhelming. The restaurant is overrated. There is better food at Abreeza. Don't bring outside food or drinks to the pool area or you will be chased away like we were.
Very helpful with the group of 4. I’ve been to Seda Abreeza back in 2016 and enjoyed it immensely.
more choices of foods. i hope someday it would b much bigger pool. the location is in the center o the davao . right infront of abreeza mall .frontdesk adrian is very attentive and friendly .
Just waited for room service for a while, fix the issue.. more people needed!!

Somewhat Good points: -Breakfast and service at the mistó was good but still waited few mins for our turn. -Internet was not that bad around the lobby area and was able to use the Mac for my work for few mins. Bad points: - Walls are not sound proof you can hear people talking at the hallway and can hear the other room's noise next to my room. Lot of noise -No door stopper at the main door it clash directly to the closet cabinet. -hand shower at the toilet is located on the left side which is not convenient to grab -Carpet at the hallway needs some drycleaning it didn't smell really bad but it somehow � stinks -Guy receptionist wasnt friendly & accommodating to locals only to foreigner guests -Mini bar stinks not even a working cooler -False ad was expecting hot tub but theres none thats the only reason I book it pls update your advertisement Sorry for being meticulous but overall not worth the price. I am not an important person to rate but think of it as an opportunity to improve your overall service. I am from Davao and would like you to improve.

We booked the club room and it was worth it. All day free refr3shments (juice, bottled water and soda). All you can eat Snacks from 2-4pm and cocktails at 5-7pm at the club lounge. For me its enough to fill in for lunch and dinner but for those who loves rice this may not be enough. For the breakfast queue at the Misto is quite long. Possible due to the holidays. At around 8am we are already at 8th in the queu. And the spread is enough but Marco Polo is still better.. The pool is small while the room is not sound proof. You can hear people outside ur room walking/talking. Overall club room was worth it. Especially that we had availed the discounted rate at Agoda.
My compliments goes more to the hardworking and efficient staff this hotel have. Great teamwork.

whenever me and my mom visit Davao, we always check in here. this is our 3rd time checking in sa Seda. i think na cozy na sila mama sa place and plus, the staff are very nice, specially ung bell boy. they helped my mom keep the durian sa freezer ata nila so it wont get rotten plus they helped mama pack the boxes for the fruits.
The wife and came here for 3 nights and were very happy with the Hotel. The room was comforting and a great location to restaurants and right across the street from the mall.
Good location, the hotel and amenities was okay. Small gym.
Cozy interiors (I checked in deluxe) efficient staff, very courteous and considerate. Very clean. Carpeting could help solve acoustic/hallway noise issue. Massage service awesome. 👍👌
Nice Staff, clean, one of the best options if safety is your concern.. The internet is not quite fast enough to depend on if you are working online for a living and or its very important to you.
The room is clean and comfortable. Staff are courteous and very good breakfast.
everything's perfect! near everywhere. great bfast buffet

Most preferred hotel in Davao City due to the convenience it Offers , I.e; close proximity to Abreeza mall and other establishments. Great staff and I would like to specially commend Staff Jayson for being so efficient , gracious and accommodating. Special thanks as well to all the front desk personnels and the guards . Thank you for making our stay a very pleasant one.

Pro: location -next to a mall. Friendly and helpful staff , good breakfast. Con: location, traffic jam in the morning and evening. Breakfast, long queue. Overall: still one of the better hotels in Davao but a bit pricey.
Seda is a very nice hotel very friendly staff and walking distance to the malls.
Everything was great! To improve more, Seda should update their carpets. Also, when a customer checks in, take them to their room.
We were very impressed with everything seda has. Specially their executive lounge.
The area of the hotel has heavy traffic, making transportation difficult.
breakfast could be better (waited a long time for my butter)
The hotel staff is so accommodating, great location.
3rd time staying at Seda hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff and convenient location.

Having been a regular guest at this hotel this year with my one year old daughter, I was very disappointed with my recent stay. Even though I had clearly stated in my reservation that I would be arriving between 5-6pm, when I arrived at the hotel from the airport around 6:45pm, I was told that there were no available rooms as the rooms had not been cleaned yet. I was told to wait in the lobby with a hungry baby. We were finally escorted to our room after about a 30 mins wait but the room was a disappointment. Having stayed in the same room in my last stay, the room cleaning was a total rush job where the cleaner failed to leave small hand towels or a bath mat. No kettle even though there was one last time and the safe was locked shut. Breakfast upstairs in the lounge was a disappointment was well. A request for a high chair for my daughter was quickly dismissed as they were all supposedly in use, yet when I walked around to get my food, there was an empty high chair in the corner of the room. Clearly the staff were more busy with something else but it was not cleaning or making the breakfast experience a pleasing one. The tables were dirty and had not been wiped and there were no cutlery. Many guests including myself had to request for them several times before a spoon and fork finally appeared. Davao City now has several good hotels to choose from so I will think carefully where I will stay later this month when I travel back there again.
Thin walls... Can hear next room chatter
No comment
Wasn’t happy with my stay at the hotel. I expected more of what I’ve paid for. I didn’t get the value of what I paid for. Wouldn’t recommend it for foreign friends.

We made a booking to Seda Davao because of what we have experienced in Seda BGC and Seda Iloilo. But wrong hotel choice, it seems that Seda Davao has not been informed of their service standards. First we were greeted by a snob hotel driver, we moved on after the Front Office apologized. But they rub salt into the wound when the Front Office staff took note of our credit card details even if our payment pushed thru.

When we arrived nobody assist us when in fact 3guards are available at that time, nobody helps us when we disembark our baggages, (For your information: we have 2 kids with us at that time); BUT they helped the next customer, we are so disappointed, we are a constant client of SEDA your records shows, Now we are having second thoughts if we will go back 😞😞😞
Love the location
Wonderful place. I'll remember it. Good example of Philippine hospitality. Be sure to select 'breakfast option' or you'll pay 600 pesos ($11) for it. If you eat a big breakfast, it's a good deal.

Nice pool the choice of international foods was great but menu changes daily sometimes for local foods bad luck if you don't like local foods like rice and fish close to all things the rooms very if you got a small room it's a bit simple you pay more you get something impressive to open your eyes all up I like it.

I booked two bedroom accomodation in 10th floor my panrens and my sister stayed there. They love the service and the place. The most who enjoyed my dad 90yrs old celebrated his surprised bday in the hotel. Thanks very much Seda i will highly recommend the Hotel.
No foul smells and everything works fine due to it being recently built. The location next to a Mall is nice and the location is in the heart of the city.
-Very courteous & responsive staff -Comfortable rooms -Convenient location
Rooms are new and well maintained. Staff are courteous and breakfast is good. Plus great location!! Thumbs up!
Location is good, next to a mall. Breakfast is alright but not refilled fast enough. Will stay here again.

The hotel is near to everything you might need, shops, restaurant, cafe, massage/spa, local tourist destination & church. Transportation is not a problem as many jeepneys pass Abreeza and Grab-taxi is easy to book. We will definitely recommend it and will surely stay there when in Davao.

What stood out for me is the location. The amenities is wonderful for busy business travelers like me ex. the gym is quite spacious. I also like the fact that the slippers are thick and comfortable. Reusable. My one big turn off is the staff, esp at the front desk, needs more training in courtesy. Needs to smile more often with a positive disposition.
Our group was happy to have spent our team building here.
Torn bedsheet, fluid stains on the bed runner, dirty chair (by the desk), no hairdryer, no hand towel on the first day
Very convenient location, clean and comfortable rooms, friendly and accommodating staffs. I would highly recommend Seda Hotel to everyone. Would surely come back soon!
the hotel is more pricey than the others. but accessible to the abreeza mall. what i dont like is , a lot of traffic on the way to the hotel! but hotel it self is okey

If you have the room at 9-10-11 floors with a balcony you have an access to the lounge, perfectly to your breakfast and afternoon tea. This hotel was so much better than Marco Polo Hotel. So I am very pleased. Sincerely yours Stefan s
Staff good, best breakfast buffet in Davao City
I am satisfy to stay here because the location is very good,very closed to mall and the room is clean as well

Easy access to downtown area. The staff are all friendly and efficient. I commend the front desk staff, the check in / out process is fast and easy. I felt Davao's hospitality at its best with sincerity. I had a great stay!

My family loves the room and its ease of access to Abreeza Mall. Though the pool was quite small - could barely fit 20 adults.The breakfast was delicious, my mother loved the unsalted danggit. :) I loved the bacon - not too salty.

Nice building coz it's new accommodating staff.. I celebrate my 40th bday I booked for our dinner. I was disappointed coz the foods are served in cold. I choose already the foods in order so that they can prepare well but sadness they served foods maybe 10 minutes after they cooked.. buffet breakfast is good and many have choices..

Superb stay here. I made a quick trip to the Philippines from the states and came straight to Davao for the 2017 Kadayawan. I stayed a total of 5 nights but I spent 2 nights here at SEDA and 3 nights downtown to be close to the activities and parades. I booked a room with executive lounge access that was on the 10th floor, while the executive lounge was one floor above. I had checked out of my downtown hotel after the kadayawan festivities mid-morning and they allowed me to check in upon arrival at around 10am. Staff bent over backwards and I didn't even have to ask. Didn't have to ask for a room with a great view of the city, but I sure got one, an end room with an absolutely awesome wide view. It was great falling asleep at night above the light of the city. I had a major fall during a mountain trail run the day before, and one of my wounds that I didn't get stitched that needed it, reopened and bled a fair amount. I called the front desk and asked if they had bandages and staff came up to my room with a large first aid kit and took care of it. Thanks so much Seda, I will be back around Araw ng Dabaw 2018!
I think Seda is the best hotel in Davao. Great rooms, awesome food, well trained staff and the perfect location. At this price point you cannot do better.
- location is very accessible - friendly staff everywhere especially at club lounge - clean & comfortable room
great location, good foods! we'll come back definitely...

HAD TO WAIT SEVERAL HOURS AFTER TWO CHECK--IN TIME TO CHECK IN. LOST MONEY FOR WHAT I PAID FOR AND I ALL GOT WAS A SORRY FULLY BOOKED YOU HAVE TO WAIT FOR ROOM. WHAT I PAID FOR A CERTAIN CHECK IN TIME AND LEFT TAGUM UST TO GET THERE AND WAIT IN LOBBY??? VERY DISAPPOINTED
Great variety of breakfast meals and its just a walking distnce to the shopping mall.

Pros: 1. It is in the heart of the city, near to everything 2. Clean room 3. Friendly staff Cons: 1. Thin wall, if you have children specially young kids and if it throws tantrum. Neighbors can really hear it from their room

The location is good as it is owned by the mall next door. I like that you have a supermarket so close.. The gym facilities are just adequate given the size of the room, a let-down to anyone who stays there longer and wants a more substantial workout. The pool as well adequate with some direct sunlight during the day. The breakfasts were quite good with a competent wait staff. The beds are comfortable but the room itself is showing some wear.
toilet has smell.

Professional and friendly staff makes this hotel maintain its good reputation aside from its good-sized rooms and amenities. Special thanks to Ruben, Rey, Kristine and all the staff who made our stay, home away from home.

When we chk in we weren't briefed that there was a dress code at the restaurant. But those booking pls be aware that the pool good to fit only 20 heads not more.small size for dwarf would be good but if european type would better be elsewhere.i wouldnt want recommend this place even its "new".
We stayed for a day only but i enjoyed it. Location was great since it is a walking distance from abreeza mall. The room was spacious and clean. The staff were nice and polite. I highly recommend it😊

The hotel is next to Ayala Mall, had better shopping and food offering that than the SM mall 15 minutes away. the hotel room is clean, did not check out the gym (if any). the pool looks small. the restaurant does offer much food choices, but you can find plenty across the mall. Check out Boiling Crab and Shrimp (by taxi 5 minutes away)
Service from staff
Rooms are in soothing earth colors, massage closes at 1am which gives guest enough time for relaxation, 24 dining is a plus! The only thing I was concerned about is the wifi, P200/hr.
beside an ayala mall. Just 20-30 mins away from Airport. Good selection of food for breakfast
breakfast is ❤

This hotel has a good location because the abreeza mall is beside Seda hotel. The hotel is new , clean but i don't like here is that i heard some noises beside our room and the voices of the guest who are walking in the aisle interrupt us. One thing is that we arrive in davao airport around 5:30 am and the hotel has no shuttle bus . Our other friends are booked in Marco polo davao and they have a shuttle bus to bring them in the hotel ...the desk staff and driver of the Marco polo bus offered to bring us to Seda hotel for free..: i was so amaze with the marco polo service...

So dissapointed because it is a Seda hotel I thought they have a superb room and mattress. You can see from the walls and corners it slowly giving up! Didn't have a hairdryer. It should be worth half its published rate. On the positive note, buffet breakfast was great!

Hospitable staff , cleanliness and the buffet breakfast was enjoyable. I was very happy during my two days stay at this hotel that I ended up booking another room for my family. I will definitely book again to stay on my next holiday.
good breakfast buffet and nice room

We appreciate the free early check-in. We were able to rest after a very early flight from Manila. The staff were very efficient and accomodating. Breakfast selection is good and tasty. There are enough seats for hotel guests at the dining area. There is a pool but we did not try it. Security is top notch. There is a mall across the hotel and taxi is easy to find around the area.
Arrived in one of their units and it was very clean
Very clean

My stay this time was definitely better than the first one. I got the club room which unlocks the privilege of using the Executive Lounge at the 11th floor. Food and Beverage selections during breakfast and happy hour cocktails were good. Service is always good in here. The room design is similar to the one at the lower floors with the exception of the study lamp. Overall a really good stay.

Hotel Stay was overall very good. Breakfast selections were okay, but could have been better for the price of the room. Hotel room was very neat and nicely designed. It's hard to swim at the pool since location of the pool is quite awkward and very visible from the lobby.
Nice hotel
mall is right across. taxi is easy. spacious room. pool is not that huge.

This is the second time I stayed at SEDA Abreeza. Overall, our stay was still good. We were upgraded to a premium room which was very nice. My only comment is for the housekeeping to improve their services. On our second day,they forgot to give us hand towels. On our third day, they forgot to replace our towels.
Went here for staycation a couple of times. Love their bed and pillows :)

I stay at Seda everytime I visit Davao so I'm used to the service and the facilities. But this time, the housekeeping fell short of my expectations. They usually have my room made up by 9 or 10am at the latest (I usually request housekeeping at 7), but this time, housekeeping came by at 1pm -- and only after I called the front desk to follow up. The breakfast buffet is also a bit disappointing (specifically the hashbrowns, the bacon, and the sausages). These are what I always get, so I have basis for comparison and I'm a bit disappointed this time. The taste and the texture is not up to the usual standard. Other than these, everything else was as expected. And I will still go to/recommend Seda for Davao visits.
The hotel is conveniently located next to a mall thus easy access to a good variety of food. Staff were friendly and helpful.
Staff needs to be more friendly. Thier so uptight.
I like the feel of the room. Very clean, very homey. Great advantage is, its just beside Abreeza Mall. The food is delicious too. Seda will always be my first choice. Keep it up!

This is very ideal place to stay into. Id appreciate if their rest rooms have bidet or at least pail and dipper. You can have these things requested though. It would have been better if theyd have the initiative to put them inside the room. The buffet breakfast is one of the best thing of checking in. There are varieties of food to choose from. This is also right across Abreeza Mall which makes it more convenient to tourists.

Our stay was very comfortable and I appreciated the extra effort the staff extended our little boy who felt very at home. Shout out to ballhop Lito who instantly became a friend to us for looking after our boy's needs. One thing to be improved can be the coordination at the front desk because right after I called to ask for assitance with our bags, we got a call asking if we will extend our stay. But no biggie! Overall stay and service was great!👍🏼

I booked this for my parents. We loved how it's directly in front of Abreeza Mall, very convenient for shopping and dining. We also loved the privacy of the Executive Lounge on the top floor. They serve free coffee and tea at 2-4pm and free cocktails at 5-7pm. Those amenities alone make the executive rooms already worth it. I just hope they do something about the walls in the rooms. It's not soundproof. We could hear the noise from the hallway and the adjacent rooms.

Very noisy room. No sound insulation at all. Will be waken up by noisy door closing sound by neighbouring rooms. Can hear clearly what TV channel our neighbour is watching! Amount paid is too excessive for this room type. Room quality is lower than 3 star!
Our request for a connecting room or even adjacent room was not meet. Our rooms were 901 and 912. This set up is difficult in case of emergency like earthquake which happened during our stay.
Small room but good location. Near abreeza mall.

I am very satisfied with their service, their staff is very accommodating. The room was clean and spacious. The location is great easy access to malls and restaurants. And btw i miss their durian coffee!

Will definitely stay here again in the future.

My friends and I had a staycation at Seda Davao during the holiday season. Primarily chose this hotel for its spacious rooms and convenient location. Check-in was a breeze. Very kind to give early check in and late check out.

I expected that it was arranged already yet during check-in they were still looking for rooms that we can have. Breakfast was okay. Staff who served during breakfast were really nice. Pool staff was also nice. Room - okay but could have a chair or a small sofa even for a deluxe room. I never experienced this in any hotel I ever stayed in for the past 30 years. I think they could of easily accomplished their goals if they started the drill at 11AM and not compromised the guests so early. Breakfast buffet is minimal. Gym only has about 5 machines. The big advantage to this hotel is that it is fairly new so it is pretty clean. Also the location is directly across from the Ayala Mall. Years of staying in hotels and I have never experienced such a bunch of indifferent hotel staff. it was just one service disappointment after another. From the time I arrived to check in, I was horrified my bags were left in the middle of the lobby behind me, someone could have just walked away with it. You guessed it, I had to roll my bags up myself. No one was there to assist. Two days in a row I came back to the room the same way I left it in the morning. I complained about the air-condition vents and nobody came so I had to work on it myself. Twice I ran into a tie wearing staff and believe it or not, he did not even look up to greet me, where normally they would just be too smiley and helpful, eager to strike a connection. I had to push my floor button. AND TO THINK I WAS BOOKED IN A CLUB ROOM!!!

The hotel is in strategic location, across Abreeza Mall and 30mins away from the airport. We booked in a Club Room which is perfect for vacationing couple like us as it provide access to the Club lounge where you can have breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails without paying extra. The area around the hotel and mall is great for a breeze walk and jogging, then capped it with few stretches in the gym and a quick deep in the adjacent pool. There are function rooms too in the mezzanine which you can book for that mini-conference or business meetings. The staff are courteous and always cheerfully help you on your requests.

We have stayed at Seda in Davao twice now, and both times we have really enjoyed it. The staff is outstanding--friendly, helpful, remembered us from our previous stay, and really just made for a terrific stay overall. (in particular, Jun went above and beyond to help us feel comfortable both times we've stayed!) My only comments, and they are small ones, relate to details that could be improved in order to compete with Davao's other top notch hotels. The bathrooms are very clean, but need some touch up paint. The towels also look like they could stand to be replaced in order to give the feeling of luxury that matches the rest of the hotel. Also, the shower door didn't close properly which caused our bathroom to be wet for the majority of our stay. The pool is the only other area that I would comment on--the chair situation is difficult is there is more than one group using the pool. There need to be more lounge chairs there for people to relax and enjoy the pool. I know this may sound like very small things, which they are. Seda is a beautiful hotel with great staff and a great location. Thanks for making our stay wonderful!

To objectives of my recent trips are the following: a) visit my parents, b) have time to relax and c) meet friends. All these were accomplished in a the short visit we did in Davao as the hotel is centrally located. Places that i need to visit are just a taxi drive away. In addition, Davao is a good place where you can have good food at reasonable prices. My wife and i were even able to get a very good massage at nearby spa. I will definitely be back later this year for another quick visit

Davao City has a number of hotels that provide the traveler a range of options. Seda is the practical choice perfect for a businessman or a tourist who doesn't need to pay for too much floor space; it offers comfortable accommodations in a convenient location - next to a mall! Anyway getting around Davao isn't a problem, so Seda being a little distant from the city center isn't much of an issue...
The hotel design is modern and classy with big and comfy rooms. Service is good . Very good value for money. Will definitely come back.
We are sure to book again at Seda Davao in our next trip to Davao.
